114629961251422208.text: Cleaned up the garage. Still not certain that the skunk is gone, but 98% certain is good enough for me. Moth balls out just in case.

114616588258381824.text: Well, the coast is appearing to be clear with no sign of The skunk. Eggs must have worked after all.

114614012100100096.text: Ran some errands and took a break. Ready to settle this...

114567679519621120.text: I reckon there's at least a 50% chance that skunk is still there. New tactic. I'm out running errands, and will be back with ingredients.

114563162380058624.text: I'm really wondering if it was my skunk, or a cat. Question: do cats like eggs??

114560489568215041.text: Well, wait. That may just have been a black cat. Couldn't tell.

114560091725905920.text: Success - he found the scrambled eggs in the driveway!! I closed the door and he ran off.

114551766762262528.text: Ok, eggs don't seem to be working either. I'm getting tired of wasting food. I've heard they like oatmeal, tho.

114550145403731969.text: Other thing that 'stinks' is that tomorrow is trash day, and the skunk is right by my can. I can't go two weeks with no pickup! #moving

114547434440491008.text: I'd really like to avoid a skunk/cat fight if my garage tonight. That's the main reason I'm out here.

114545439830835202.text: Did I mention that I'm selling my house in two weeks? Is skunk smell in the garage a deal breaker?!?

114544889177452544.text: Decided to scramble some eggs, since I heard skunks like those. Hopefully more than hot dogs. I just put the eggs down, so we'll see.

114543649320214528.text: Apparently, skunks aren't interested in hot dogs.

114543250970382336.text: 5 mins ago, some drunk person pulled down my street, saw me sitting in the car, then left really fast.

114542584013127680.text: I'm staking out my own house until a skunk leaves the garage. Figured I might as well live tweet it...
